line_1: Bound and rebound, the old Hills, like old Rams,
line_2: The Show'rs, which make the young hills, like young Lambs,

line_1: Must yield to Belgick battering Rams.
line_2: With Wafers, Oyntments, Beads and Shams,

line_1: But all our pastures glow with purple Rams,
line_2: With scarlet Lambkins, and their yellow Dams!

line_1: And hide their lovely locks with heads of rams;
line_2: 'Tis hence belles game, intrigue, sip citron-drams,
